channel.title: envo: Definition changes
channel.description: RSS feed of definition changes in the envo

item.title: CHEBI:15611 ; sarcosine
item.description:
OLD: A N-methylglycine that has formula C3H7NO2.
NEW: The N-methyl derivative of glycine.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:16199 ; urea
item.description:
OLD: A monocarboxylic acid amide that has formula CH4N2O.
NEW: A carbonyl group with two C-bound amine groups.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:16236 ; ethanol
item.description:
OLD: An ethanol that has formula C2H6O.
NEW: A primary alcohol that is ethane in which one of the hydrogens is substituted by a hydroxy group.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:16454 ; pantothenate
item.description:
OLD: A pantothenate that has formula C9H16NO5.
NEW: A monocarboxylic acid anion that is the conjugate base of pantothenic acid, obtained by deprotonation of the carboxy group.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:16482 ; naphthalene
item.description:
OLD: An ortho-fused bicyclic arene that has formula C10H8.
NEW: An aromatic hydrocarbon comprising two fused benzene rings.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:17347 ; testosterone
item.description:
OLD: An androgen that has formula C19H28O2.
NEW: An androstanoid having 17beta-hydroxy and 3-oxo groups, together with unsaturation at C-4-C-5.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:18139 ; trimethylamine
item.description:
OLD: A methylamine that has formula C3H9N.
NEW: A tertiary amine that is ammonia in which each hydrogen atom is substituted by an methyl group.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:24431 ; chemical entity
item.description:
(was molecular structure)

OLD: A description of the molecular entity or part thereof based on its composition and/or the connectivity between its constituent atoms.
NEW: A chemical entity is a physical entity of interest in chemistry including molecular entities, parts thereof, and chemical substances.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:24828 ; indoles
item.description:
OLD: Compounds containing an indole skeleton.
NEW: Any compound containing an indole skeleton.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:27798 ; nitrobenzene
item.description:
OLD: A nitroarene that has formula C6H5NO2.
NEW: A nitroarene consisting of benzene carrying a single nitro substituent.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:27856 ; acetamide
item.description:
OLD: An acetamide that has formula C2H5NO.
NEW: A member of the acetamides that has formula C2H5NO.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:29125 ; arsenate(3-)
item.description:
OLD: An arsenate ion that has formula AsO4.
NEW: An arsenate ion resulting from the removal of three protons from arsenic acid.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:33250 ; atom
item.description:
OLD: An atom is the smallest particle still characterizing a chemical element.
NEW: A chemical entity constituting the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:33285 ; heteroorganic entity
item.description:
OLD: A heteroorganic entity is one in which carbon atoms or organic groups are bonded directly to one or more heteroatoms.
NEW: A heteroorganic entity is an organic molecular entity in which carbon atoms or organic groups are bonded directly to one or more heteroatoms.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:33575 ; carboxylic acid
item.description:
OLD: An oxoacid having the structure RC(=O)OH. The term is used as a suffix in systematic name formation to denote the -C(=O)OH group including its carbon atom.
NEW: A carbon oxoacid acid carrying at least one -C(=O)OH group and having the structure RC(=O)OH, where R is any any monovalent functional group. Carboxylic acids are the most common type of organic acid.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:35352 ; organonitrogen compound
item.description:
OLD: A compound containing at least one carbon-nitrogen bond.
NEW: Any heteroorganic entity containing at least one carbon-nitrogen bond.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:35715 ; nitro compound
item.description:
OLD: A compound having the nitro group, -NO2 (free valence on nitrogen), which may be attached to carbon, nitrogen (as in nitramines), or oxygen (as in nitrates), among other elements (in the absence of specification, C-nitro compounds are usually implied).
NEW: A compound having a nitro group, -NO2 (free valence on nitrogen), which may be attached to carbon, nitrogen (as in nitramines), or oxygen (as in nitrates), among other elements (in the absence of specification, C-nitro compounds are usually implied).

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:35716 ; C-nitro compound
item.description:
OLD: A compound having the nitro group (-NO2) attached to carbon atom.
NEW: A nitro compound having the nitro group (-NO2) attached to a carbon atom.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:36963 ; organooxygen compound
item.description:
OLD: An organooxygen compound is a compound containing at least one carbon-oxygen bond.
NEW: An organochalcogen compound containing at least one carbon-oxygen bond.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:37622 ; carboxamide
item.description:
OLD: Amides of carboxylic acids, having the structure RC(=O)NR2. The term is used as a suffix in systematic name formation to denote the -C(=O)NH2 group including its carbon atom.
NEW: An amide of a carboxylic acid, having the structure RC(=O)NR2. The term is used as a suffix in systematic name formation to denote the -C(=O)NH2 group including its carbon atom.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: CHEBI:50860 ; organic molecular entity
item.description:
OLD: A molecular entity that contains carbon.
NEW: Any molecular entity that contains carbon.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: ENVO:00000339 ; piece of rock
item.description:
OLD: An abiotic mesoscopic feature made of the mineral material of the crust of the Earth.
NEW: An abiotic mesoscopic feature made of the mineral material of the crust of the Earth.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: ENVO:00000341 ; piece of gravel
item.description:
OLD: rock whose pieces are at least two millimeters (2mm) in its largest dimension (about 1/12 of an inch) and no more than 75 millimeters (about 3 inches).
NEW: A piece of rock that is two millimeters (2mm) in its largest dimension (about 1/12 of an inch) and no more than 75 millimeters (about 3 inches).

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: PATO:0000033 ; concentration of
item.description:
OLD: A quality of related physical entities inhering in a substance by virtue of the amount of the bearer's there is mixed with another substance.
NEW: A quality inhering in a substance by virtue of the amount of the bearer's there is mixed with another substance.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: PATO:0000085 ; sensitivity toward
item.description:
OLD: A quality of related physical entities inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's propensity to detect or perceive external stimulation.
NEW: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's disposition to detect or perceive external stimulation.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: PATO:0001018 ; physical quality
item.description:
OLD: A quality of a single physical entity that exists through action of continuants at the physical level of organisation.
NEW: A quality of a physical entity that exists through action of continuants at the physical level of organisation in relation to other entities.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: PATO:0001305 ; increased temperature
item.description:
OLD: A temperature which is greater relative to the normal or average temperature.
NEW: A temperature which is relatively high.

AmiGO | QuickGO

item.title: PATO:0000085 ; sensitivity toward
item.description:
OLD: A quality of related physical entities inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's propensity to detect or perceive external stimulation.
NEW: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's disposition to detect or perceive external stimulation.

AmiGO | QuickGO
